intro: Erigeron morelensis, commonly known as the Morelles fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron morelensis is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid conditions with its hairy, gray-green foliage.
